name: Mount Madison

trails_config.name: Valley Way Trail
trails_config.description: The most popular route to Madison, Valley Way offers a sheltered climb through forest to the AMC Madison Spring Hut. A short, rocky spur leads to the summit cone, where sweeping 360° vistas await in the alpine zone.

trails_config.name: Madison Gulf Trail
trails_config.description: A remote and rugged approach ascending via Madison Gulf, one of the steepest trails in the Whites. The climb features wet slabs and wild scrambles in a deep ravine. Looping back via Osgood Trail provides safer descent after conquering this technical route.

current_conditions.ai_summary: A spectacular hike located in New Hampshire. Standing at 5367 feet, Mount Madison offers breathtaking views and a rewarding challenge for hikers of all levels.
risk_factors: Check local trail conditions before departing.
Start early to avoid afternoon storms.

generated_description:
The Experience

Standing at 5367 feet, Mount Madison is a standout peak in New Hampshire. Known for its approachable and scenic terrain, it offers a quintessential hiking experience.

The Challenge

Hikers often choose the **Valley Way Trail**, a **8.4 mile** route gaining significant elevation. As part of the **NH48 4000-Footers**, it draws peak-baggers from across the region.

Peak Bagging Logic

**Peak Bagging Opportunity:** Consider connecting this hike with **Mount Adams**, which is just 0.9 miles away. Linking these peaks is a popular way to maximize your day on the trail.
